Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: narrow reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) below; part of lotus flower with added red centre and added white outline above two faded white bands; exterior: narrow black band at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx (curlicue, trace of neck, wing with red and trace of back remaining), to left.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 849, pl. 118)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1042) (phase 2)
